final_topics.title: Solid Practitioners Meetings Logistics
final_topics.summary: These groups coordinate the logistics of the Solid Practitioners meetings, including scheduling, time confirmations, and sharing meeting agendas, notes, and recordings. Discussions also focus on improving meeting organization, note-taking equity, and resolving scheduling conflicts to ensure smooth and accessible meetings for participants.

final_topics.title: Solid-OIDC Provider Metadata Standardization
final_topics.summary: These discussions center on standardizing metadata for Solid-OIDC providers to improve the user experience during login and registration. The conversations explore the need for programmatically accessible definitions, labels, and icons from Pod providers' WebID documents to ensure consistency and ease of use across different Solid applications.

final_topics.title: Solid Application Interoperability (SAI)
final_topics.summary: These groups discuss user experience and access control considerations for Solid applications, particularly within the context of Solid Application Interoperability (SAI).  The conversations explore clear communication of data access levels (public, private, shared) to users, with a focus on effectively handling PII and leveraging naming conventions.

final_topics.title: Community Pods and Group Management
final_topics.summary: The groups focus on community pod setup, access control, and architectural designs for federated geosearch. Discussions involve creating and debugging group pods on TrinPod, exploring access management using private triples, and recommending community pods for efficient data aggregation and governance in geospatial applications.

final_topics.title: Solid Data Indexing and Search
final_topics.summary: The conversations revolve around Solid data indexing and search capabilities, aiming to improve search functionality in Solid applications. Discussions cover various indexing strategies, the need for a standardized search API, the sharing of existing implementations, and announcements for upcoming workshops and sessions related to decentralized search across Solid Pods.

final_topics.title: Solid Web Components Development
final_topics.summary: These discussions center on developing web components for Solid, focusing on tools, libraries, and integration strategies. Developers coordinate meetups to tackle technical challenges like reactive rendering and interoperability, ultimately creating a GitHub wiki for ongoing collaboration.

final_topics.title: Sleepy Bike Project Updates
final_topics.summary: The Sleepy Bike project's progress and challenges are discussed, including its geographic scope, relationship with WarmShowers, and technical implementation. Updates reveal internal struggles, resulting in a project 'schism', alongside requests for advice about bike rentals.

final_topics.title: Solid Governance and Community
final_topics.summary: Conversations revolve around Solid governance, including the Practitioners Group's role, elections for co-chairs, and representation on the ODI Advisory Committee. Issues of censorship, privacy, conflict resolution (like the SolidCouch issue), and collaboration with other communities like Valueflows are also addressed.

final_topics.title: Solid Notifications Implementation
final_topics.summary: The implementation of Solid notifications is discussed, covering topics such as different approaches to webhooks and support across different Pod providers. A dedicated Matrix chat channel for Real Time Solid (RTS) efforts was created to facilitate better coordination, while scheduled meetings faced rescheduling and a hiatus due to low attendance.

final_topics.title: RDF and Linked Data Shapes
final_topics.summary: RDF and Linked Data Shapes are explored, including collaboration on SHACL shapes and ontologies, and developing a Linked Data Shape Manager. Discussions cover binary RDF formats like HDT and CBOR-LD, with one member releasing a tool to convert DICOM metadata to RDF.

final_topics.title: Solid Monetization Ethics and Strategy
final_topics.summary: The group debated a proposal regarding "Value Generation and Monetization Strategies" for Solid Practitioners, balancing the need for economic sustainability (to drive adoption) with core community values opposing data privatization and exploitation, referencing the WarmShowers failure.

final_topics.title: Solid Explainer and Onboarding
final_topics.summary: These groups are exploring ways to educate newcomers about Solid, including experimenting with a personalized GPT agent trained on Solid information. Discussions also focus on creating explainer content highlighting Solid's practical applications and coordinating efforts with the W3C Community Group 'Solid Explainer' initiative to improve onboarding.

final_topics.title: Group Scope and Project Focus
final_topics.summary: A member declined an invitation to join the W3C Solid Community Group due to time constraints, leading to a clarification that the Practitioners group prioritizes active project work over general Solid happenings.

final_topics.title: Solid Data Modules Promotion
final_topics.summary: These groups focus on promoting and sharing information about Solid Data Modules and Data Wallets. The conversations involve sharing content on platforms like wedistribute.org and disseminating blog posts to clarify concepts related to data management with Solid.

final_topics.title: Solid Career Data PoC Guidance
final_topics.summary: A newcomer sought advice for building a Proof of Concept (PoC) for career data management, leading to community recommendations favoring the Community Solid Server (CSS), Javascript/Typescript, and guidance on ontology and interoperability conventions.

final_topics.title: Solvent Native Solid Apps
final_topics.summary: An announcement was made regarding Solvent, a project enabling Solid applications to run natively over a user's file system using Manas and Tauri.

final_topics.title: Solid Localization Strategy
final_topics.summary: The Solid Localization Strategy groups are discussing the best tools and workflows for translating Solid projects into multiple languages. Conversations cover platforms like Weblate, frameworks like Fluent and Vue i18n, and integrating RDF data from sources like Wikidata for internationalization.

final_topics.title: Solid Production Use and Servers
final_topics.summary: These groups explore the readiness of Solid for production use, covering topics like server implementations, security considerations (including HIPAA compliance), and infrastructure migrations.  Members are also sharing resources, such as a PeerTube channel for Solid practitioners and documentation for DIY Solid setups, along with announcements like the Solid World call for speakers.

final_topics.title: Solid Job Search and Resources
final_topics.summary: These groups revolve around job opportunities within the Solid ecosystem. Participants are sharing job search resources and announcements, including ODI's recruitment for multiple Solid roles, with a focus on candidates able to work in London.

final_topics.title: Spanish-Language Solid Forum Discussions
final_topics.summary: Jeff Zucker shared a link to a Spanish-language discussion on the Solid forum (Podspace), leading to positive engagement and cross-invitation from Spanish-speaking members.

final_topics.title: Solid Development Inspiration Sources
final_topics.summary: Mariha requested high-level vision and narrow technical resources to encourage a return to software development, receiving several links tailored to her background in distributed systems.

final_topics.title: Solid and Fediverse Integration
final_topics.summary: These conversations centered on integrating Solid with the Fediverse, including discussions on specific tools like Mastopod and Peertube, the ActivityPods approach, and the launch of a new federated forum on We Distribute. Users shared experiences, troubleshooting tips, and announcements related to connecting Solid with decentralized social networks.

final_topics.title: Group Membership Requirements
final_topics.summary: The group clarified that formal organizational affiliation is not required for membership in certain Solid groups, leading to a brief mention of Inrupt hiring status.

final_topics.title: Solid Server-Side Pagination Challenges
final_topics.summary: Participants discussed the current lack of standardized server-side pagination methods in Solid for handling large datasets like chat logs, noting existing workarounds and limitations regarding document vs. triple level operations.

final_topics.title: Message Signing Standard (RFC 9421)
final_topics.summary: Following a discussion on cryptographic keys, an accepted standard (RFC 9421) for message signing was introduced, prompting planning for a future dedicated meeting in March to discuss its application within Solid.

final_topics.title: Server Practitioners Subgroup Proposal
final_topics.summary: A proposal was made and supported to establish a subgroup dedicated to Server Practitioners to enhance alignment and functionality deployment, alongside feedback requesting corrections to the recent search API meeting notes.

final_topics.title: Solid Hackathon Planning
final_topics.summary: The discussions revolved around planning non-competitive Solid hackathons focused on specific projects like PASS, outlining goals, structure, and reflecting on the nature of such events. A Gitter chat room link was shared, likely intended to facilitate real-time collaboration during the hackathon.

final_topics.title: Solid Interoperability Practices Discussion
final_topics.summary: The discussions explore Solid interoperability challenges, sharing resources and exploring different architectural approaches. The focus is on contrasting 'everything apps' like Anytype with specialized apps relying on strong interoperability, highlighting the potential role of PodOS in bridging this gap.

final_topics.title: Startup Introductions and Solid Integration
final_topics.summary: A non-technical startup from Australia introduced themselves, expressing interest in integrating Solid Pods and seeking connections with local experts or Inrupt for collaboration.

final_topics.title: Oracle Aconex Accelerator Announcement
final_topics.summary: An announcement was made regarding the launch of the Oracle Aconex Accelerator, integrating Solid technology into Construction technology.

final_topics.title: Solid Search Research Project
final_topics.summary: Mohammad Bahrani from the University of Southampton introduced his research project focused on efficient, secure, and sovereign search over Solid pods using LLMs and Federated Learning.

final_topics.title: Solid Catalog Restructuring
final_topics.summary: The team decided to separate the Solid Catalog data from specific applications by moving it to its own repository to improve data independence and requested community feedback on the structure.

final_topics.title: Activity Pods Technical Discussion
final_topics.summary: These conversations centered on the technical aspects of ActivityPods, including ActivityPub implementation over Solid, ODRL, and RDF document structure requirements. Developers shared compatibility reports detailing issues encountered while adapting applications to ActivityPods.

final_topics.title: Conflict-Free Replicated Data Types
final_topics.summary: Links were shared referencing a W3C public-solid email announcing the scheduling of a meeting focused on Conflict-free Replicated Data Types (CRTDs) in Solid.

final_topics.title: Solid Developers in Mexico Networking
final_topics.summary: Jeff Zucker facilitated an introduction between two members interested in discussing the application and policies of Solid technology within the context of the Mexican government.

final_topics.title: ActivityPub Integration Inbox Validation
final_topics.summary: The discussion involved announcing a forum post on integrating ActivityPub into Solid specs, related concepts like inbox validation, and mention of lost notes regarding an AP layer experiment and a new abstraction use case.

final_topics.title: Solid Use Case Contributions Call
final_topics.summary: A request was made to community members to contribute their Solid projects and use cases to a list on the Solid forum to demonstrate Solid in action.

final_topics.title: NSS Deployment Troubleshooting
final_topics.summary: A developer struggled with deploying NSS using Nginx and SSL until they identified and resolved a configuration mismatch in their firewall rules, confirming the use of Solid for multi-tenancy in a production app.

final_topics.title: Solid Events and Survey Invitations
final_topics.summary: The discussions involved planning an international panel for the upcoming Solid Symposium, inviting participation in a Solid panel discussion at the State of Open Con conference, and sharing a survey regarding SHACL shapes. There was also a discussion troubleshooting issues with link previews on Solid event calendar links.

final_topics.title: LLM Privacy and Data Integrity
final_topics.summary: These discussions center on privacy and data integrity challenges within LLMs used with Solid.  Key concerns include data forgetting, user consent, transparency in LLM training data, and the exploration of tools like RDF and Model Context Protocol (MCP) to address these issues within the Solid ecosystem.

final_topics.title: Defining Product/Service Shapes
final_topics.summary: A new working group was announced to define a common shape for Products and Services, leading to a debate on whether to use 'Project' or 'ProductOrService' as the superclass and how to model organizational relationships.

final_topics.title: JavaScript RDF Tooling Overview
final_topics.summary: The focus here is on the availability and planning for JavaScript-based tools for working with RDF data. This includes discussion of RDF library support in other languages like Python and Perl, as well as scheduling an overview presentation of existing JavaScript RDF tooling.

final_topics.title: Solid Catalog Development and Management
final_topics.summary: These conversations revolve around the development, maintenance, and governance of the Solid Catalog, a repository for Solid applications and resources. Topics include frontend development, search implementation, data correction, metadata definition, bug fixes, repository governance, and inclusion of research papers.

final_topics.title: Solid Architecture and Implementation
final_topics.summary: These discussions address the architecture and implementation of Solid, including debates on security versus interoperability in Datasolids, the architecture of projects like MANDAT, and sharing architecture-as-code tools for visualizing Solid setups.

final_topics.title: Authentication and Authorization Flows
final_topics.summary: The conversations in this cluster focus on various aspects of authentication and authorization within Solid. Topics covered include finding UMA flow implementations, harmonizing authentication specifications, authenticating non-web applications, and implementing SSO bridges for Solid applications.

final_topics.title: ODI Governance and Funding
final_topics.summary: The group was reminded to provide feedback on the proposed ODI governance structure and was provided instructions and encouragement to self-nominate for the Solid Operations Advisory Committee (OAC) before the March 30 deadline.

final_topics.title: Solid Ecosystem Applications Development
final_topics.summary: Discussions focused on application development within the Solid ecosystem. This includes sharing and requesting information about projects like 'Solid Compound' for improved UX/DX, as well as the announcement and discussion of new tools like a CSS component scaffolder designed to simplify development. Participants also followed up on presentations with technical questions about PodQuest, WebID scoped indexes, and open-sourcing the application.

final_topics.title: Data Handling and Transparency Issues
final_topics.summary: Members discussed news regarding a non-Solid initiative led by RFK Jr. to aggregate health data for research, raising concerns about consent and centralized data control.

final_topics.title: Inrupt Migration Issues Resolution
final_topics.summary: Users reported difficulties accessing resources due to broken links resulting from the Inrupt migration, including a Solid Symposium page and the Real Time Solid website, with the page owner acknowledging the issue.

final_topics.title: Web Access Control Discussions
final_topics.summary: Conversations revolved around Web Access Control (WAC) mechanisms within Solid. The group debated the historical use of `acl:trustedApp` and considered alternatives like SAI for authorization. They also explored the use of Group WebIDs versus URIs for access control, particularly for private group memberships, and inquired about dedicated channels for WAC discussions.

final_topics.title: Synovient vs. Solid Pod Comparison
final_topics.summary: A link to Synovient was shared, prompting a user to inquire about its technical differences from the open-source Solid Protocol, which could not be answered due to Synovient's lack of technical visibility.

final_topics.title: Mycelium Web Server Project Sharing
final_topics.summary: A user shared links to the GitHub repository and a Peertube video for MyceliumWebServer.

final_topics.title: Contacts Specification Migration
final_topics.summary: The Contacts client-client spec group sought feedback from practitioners regarding the feasibility of migrating from `vcard:AddressBook` to `foaf:AddressBook`, acknowledging the need for backward compatibility support over several years.

final_topics.title: AI Code Generation Feedback & Security
final_topics.summary: Members shared mixed feedback on the utility and security of GenAI code editors/copilots, discussing both positive formatting capabilities and negative experiences involving bugs and potential security vulnerabilities.

final_topics.title: Social Query Security
final_topics.summary: Josh Cornejo raises detailed questions regarding network security (DDoS) and loop prevention in decentralized social queries, which Niko addresses by detailing unique query IDs and asynchronous forwarding logic.

final_topics.title: Podcast Interview Scheduling
final_topics.summary: Jeff followed up on scheduling a podcast interview with Damon, who apologized for the delay due to a family emergency and confirmed he would reach out via email.

final_topics.title: Jitsi Technical Glitch Report
final_topics.summary: These discussions centered on technical issues related to Jitsi meetings. Users reported problems accessing the February 19th meeting recording and received troubleshooting assistance. A separate report noted a brief glitch where a participant appeared frozen during a meeting.

final_topics.title: Developer Experience and Documentation
final_topics.summary: Lukedary shared positive progress from a development day but criticized the poor quality and outdated state of official Solid documentation, especially from Inrupt, while praising community resources.

final_topics.title: Solid Adoption and Maturity Debate
final_topics.summary: Lukedary sought advice on selling Solid's data sovereignty benefit internally against existing centralized solutions, which sparked a debate between Jeff and Elf-pavlik regarding whether Solid should be characterized as an 'alpha test period' or a practical platform for applications today.

final_topics.title: LWS Naming and Solid Branding
final_topics.summary: A user inquired about a rumored name change for Solid, leading to a discussion distinguishing 'Linked Web Storage' as the technical specification from 'Solid' as the preferred solution brand.

final_topics.title: Miscellaneous and Orphaned Messages
final_topics.summary: This topic groups miscellaneous and orphaned messages that did not fit into other categories. This included unrelated code snippets, administrative notes, social exchanges, and links to external resources. Users also sought and received links to previous meeting recordings.

final_topics.title: Miscellaneous Social Logistics
final_topics.summary: This topic captures miscellaneous social interactions and channel logistics. Discussions involved greetings, directing users to appropriate channels, and general feedback regarding the Solid World event. There were also mentions of projects and updates on missed meetings.

final_topics.title: NGI Grant Application Updates
final_topics.summary: These conversations focus on the NGI Sargasso grant application process, including requests for transatlantic partnerships and documenting funding sources. There's also discussion surrounding transparency in the distribution plan for the ODI Solid grant, with specific inquiries about allocations for various stakeholders.

final_topics.title: Miscellaneous Announcements
final_topics.summary: This cluster contains various unrelated announcements ranging from product updates and technical integrations to event invitations and calls for proposals. Announcements include information about FediCon, an event for the Open Social Web, and a workshop by the ESPRESSO project on information retrieval at the Solid Symposium.

final_topics.title: Welcome and Initial Introductions
final_topics.summary: Participants shared enthusiasm for collaboration and briefly discussed past experiences with semantic web and podcasting.

final_topics.title: Matrix Space Standardization
final_topics.summary: Participants extensively worked to identify the correct official Solid Matrix space, resolve administrative rights issues, standardize the public URL, and ensure the practitioners' channel was correctly included.

final_topics.title: Unix Timestamp Celebration
final_topics.summary: A brief, off-topic announcement celebrated the Unix Timestamp reaching 1.7 billion.

final_topics.title: Greetings and Reactions
final_topics.summary: These conversations involve simple greetings, positive reactions to group initiatives, and brief acknowledgements of statements. Interactions are light-hearted and focus on establishing a positive and welcoming atmosphere.

final_topics.title: Miscellaneous Link Sharing
final_topics.summary: This cluster includes the sharing of miscellaneous external links and resources, ranging from utility tools and communication channels to academic papers and news articles. Specific links shared include ODRL examples, workshops related to geo data and AI control, and articles on decentralized systems and graph security.
